title: Bug 131649: Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table
description: This design uses a 2-level table to list offices and their employees. An expression like row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"] is expected to run correctly. However, when the user double-clicks on "COUNTRY", the correct behavior should be to insert rows[0]["COUNTRY"] into the expression. The first index (an integer) to the "rows" array represents the 0-based index of the nested table, where 0 is the outermost table, 1 is the first-level inner table, and so on.
EB: When the designer attempts to append a country name suffix to each employee name (e.g., "Diane Merphy / USA"), an expression like row["COUNTRY"] is added to the text. The issue arises as row["OFFICECODE"] is not valid in the inner table. To allow the inner table to access the outer table's columns, the expression needs to utilize the "rows" object.
SR:
1. Create a design using a 2-level table to list offices and their employees.
2. Construct an expression like row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"] and ensure it runs correctly.
3. Double-click on "COUNTRY" and observe whether rows[0]["COUNTRY"] is correctly inserted into the expression.
4. Attempt to append a country name suffix to each employee name using an expression like row["COUNTRY"] and verify the behavior.
